title: Add clear APK build instructions for Android (wrapper/TWA/WebView)

requirements.text: Update the existing “Package as Mobile App” guide page to include an explicit, step-by-step section focused on producing an installable Android APK for testing (and an AAB for Play Store), written in English and tailored to this Strager deployment URL shown on the page.

quotes: Help me for making apk of my app

acceptanceCriteria: On /mobile-app-packaging, there is a clearly labeled section such as “Build an APK (Android)”, separate from general Play Store submission guidance.
The section explains (in English) the difference between APK (local testing) and AAB (Play Store submission).

The section provides a sequential checklist a user can follow using common approaches already mentioned on the page (Android Studio WebView wrapper and/or Trusted Web Activity), without requiring any backend changes.
The guide references the current deployed site origin already displayed on the page as the website/start URL to package.

requirements.text: Add a “Trusted Web Activity (TWA) prerequisite” subsection in the Android wrapper guidance that points users to the existing Digital Asset Links files in the repo and explains, in English, that they must replace placeholders before TWA verification will work.

quotes: Help me for making apk of my app

acceptanceCriteria: The Android wrapper guidance explicitly references frontend/public/.well-known/assetlinks.json and states that the values PACKAGE_NAME_HERE and SHA256_FINGERPRINT_HERE must be replaced.
The guide links or points users to the existing instruction file frontend/public/.well-known/assetlinks.README.txt for where to obtain the package name and SHA-256 fingerprint.
User-facing wording remains accurate to the app’s constraints (i.e., the project does not automatically generate APK/AAB files).

requirements.text: Ensure the “Install Strager App” page includes a clear callout that users who specifically want an APK for installation/testing should follow the “Package as Mobile App” guide (English text).

quotes: Help me for making apk of my app

acceptanceCriteria: /install includes a short, easy-to-notice line or callout clarifying: PWA install is available directly in the browser, but APK creation requires using the /mobile-app-packaging guide.
The callout links to /mobile-app-packaging and does not introduce any new routes.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Do not claim the system generates APK/AAB/IPA artifacts automatically; documentation must clearly state external Android tooling is required.
Keep all user-facing text in English.
nonGoals: Implementing an actual Android build pipeline inside this project (Gradle/Android Studio project generation).
Producing or attaching a real APK/AAB file as an artifact from this build.
Adding new authentication providers or any non-Internet-Identity sign-in method.
